comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia/] Re your note. 1900 resumption map confirms it is the Grand Hotel. View "Plan T" on Archives Investigator - gallery.records.nsw.gov.au/index.php/galleries/maps-and-p... Also, there is a photo on Photo Investigator (not yet on Flickr) taken from Essex Street and looking south-west that shows part of the Grand Hotel (note the name in the window) - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... In the 1880s it was the site of the Coach & Horses Hotel - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/_zoomify/2008/D00663/a1367458.html Regarding the intersection of this photo (Cumberland & Little Essex), going clockwise: The south-west corner - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/8189453150/] The (soon to be vacant) north-west corner - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3810910116/] The north-east corner - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3863847256/] I've never found a photo of the south-east corner, but the Old Erin-go-bragh Hotel once stood there. See 1890 map - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/_zoomify/2008/D00663/a1367458.html

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Thank you!  I was thinking wrongly that the 'Frog Hollow' photo was taken from on top of the Grand Hotel,  but that was Gloucester, not Cumberland St.  All so very muddling ...

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I'm just glad you didn't confuse 'Frog Hollow' with the one in Surry Hills. That would have been embarrassing :)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The 'North City Fire Brigade' seems to have been a volunteer organization from the 1880s, not part of the Metropolitan Fire Service. It suffered registration problems in 1896 (bureaucratic jealousies and bungling?) - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14059846 . Still going in 1903 - the fellow at the window could be one of these people - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14502563

comment.author: 61223299@N00
comment._content:
For those of us trying to navigate old sydney, I've put together a composite of the resumption map and something a little more recent. Enjoy!

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/noctorum/8199274598/in/photostream]

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: The Fire Station was immediately adjacent to the east end of the current position of the southern Harbour Bridge toll booths. Strange it lasted at all, considering the Metropolitan Fire Brigades' George Street North (Circular Quay) Station opened in 1891 and was some 300 metres away.
